summary: H.R. 2922, also known as Hammers' Law, amends U.S. Code Title 46, Section 30307, to provide authorization for nonpecuniary damages (loss of care, comfort, and companionship) in cases resulting from cruise ship voyages on the high seas. The bill defines "cruise ship" and makes corresponding changes to limitations in certain cases, mirroring existing provisions for commercial aviation accidents. The bill aims to provide legal recourse for passengers impacted by cruise ship incidents.
